Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased NH Vittorio Veneto”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan S
Reviews.Content: We tried so hard to find the right hotel with the quality, the space for our large family and the right location. We did a pretty good job with NH. The hotel is fresh, clean, modern, and in a great location. Our rooms were spacious--unusual for Rome. We walked easily to the Spanish Steps down Vittorio Veneto and yet were also very pleased to be on a quiet part of the street. Breakfast was good. The service was good. Whenever we asked the front desk for guidance were treated well and we were given pretty good advice.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff and spotless hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobSouthampton
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a couple of nights for the England/Italy rugby match. The weather was bad and we were late arriving. The bar was due to close at midnight but they extended the hours to make sure we were all fed. The rooms were stylish and spotlessly clean and there were an extensive range of toiletries in the bathroom. Breakfast was good with every type of croissant yup could imagine plus a buffet style fried breakfast. The staff were helpful and friendly, the service was good and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Rome”
Reviews.Author: pbruno33
Reviews.Content: I loved this Hotel, it was real close to Via Veneto and T-station, walkable to just about everywhere, Vacatian, S.Steps, Trev Fou,,,etc. lots of places close by to eat high and low end...the hotel it self isn't anything fancy but it was clean the people where great, nice lounge and good breakfast (euro style). I would def go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No personality”
Reviews.Author: Louise101010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and tidy and the rooms are of a good size. The staff were freindly and helpful. When we arrived however, we had four large suitcases and stairs to walk down and there was no-one to help. We stayed here over the Christmas period and I had chosen this hotel because it has a restaurant. i telephoned the hotel a month before visiting to ensure that I had a table booked in the restaurant on Christmas Day. A couple of days after we arrived I asked for the Christmas day menu to be told that the restaurant would be closed. They recommended another restaurant, which we did eat in but this was awful and overpriced. This hotel has no personality. It is bland and characterless but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Just returned Perfect !!”
Reviews.Author: karenstu
Reviews.Content: We arrived and yes everyone the steps are fine just a slightly different reception layout you go down to reception either via the lift or the sweeping stair case. Reception staff were perfect requested a room overlooking park which they arranged. Rooms were toasty warm all clean tidy and in our opinion good quality. Location was spot on out of hotel right across a small walk way and your in the Via Veneto two minutes fro Metro albeit a bit of a walk along the normal tube walk way but 4 Euros for a all day pass....brilliant value We walked to Spanish Steps and back from the Colosseum stopping at a few bars on the way but a lovely walk. So its a fab hotel fab location we had a fab time go and enjoy !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “the only positive is the location”
Reviews.Author: travelbern58
Reviews.Content: This NH hotel is located quite centrally and within walking distace to the Spanish steps...but this is the only positive think I can report. I had a small room at the end of endless aisles, despite double windows very noisy. Reception, restaurant, bar in the beasement, no light. Breakfast and lunch not exciting.

Reviews.Title: “Ugly hotel”
Reviews.Author: abisorkk
Reviews.Content: You have to go downstairs from the street to the loby no portier no elvator. Too long coridors. The rooms cleaner forget to provide basics toalets like shampo and soap. The price of the room internet is very high. The free WiFi internet in the loby is provided for 3o min. and you must ask for new password each every 30. min

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a decent location.”
Reviews.Author: A-Villan
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very modern in terms of design and furniture, and it looks pretty new from the inside. Rooms were ok in size (given the fact that you're in Europe), and excellent in terms of cleanliness. Breakfast was wonderful. A lot of things to choose from. Location of the hotel was just ok. It is very close to the via veneto, where you will find many good restaurants. the closest metro station is the Spagna, but you will have to walk for about 10 minutes to reach it, and the good thing is that once you exit the hotel and walk toward via veneto, you will see an underground tunnel which will take you straight to the metro station. So you don't have to cross any streets or look for it, this tunnel will save you that trouble. Walking to the main shopping street of via del corso took us around 20 minutes, but we didn't mind since the weather was nice. Once we reached the via del corso, it took us another 10 min to reach the trevi fountain. The only complain about this hotel is the room key card. The magnetic stripe is really sensitive. Put it in your wallet or near your cell phone and it will immediately stop working. We had to go to the reception to get it reprogrammed every time we came back. The other complain is the dull and dark entrance to the hotel. Once you enter the building you have to go down the stairs to the reception, which is very annoying if you have luggage with you, and their bell boy is most of the time not there to help out.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay & Location”
Reviews.Author: rrw715
Reviews.Content: Recently vacationed for a 1st time visit for Rome. Was somewhat concerned that this hotel would not meet expectations or the location would be a challenge based upon mixed feedback. The Good: Hotel was very pleasant and staff were courteous and helpful throughout our stay. The room Itself was comfortable, slightly smaller, but within expectations for a european hotel room. Very modern, clean and enjoyable. We found the location was a block away from a metro and dedicated taxi stand. So getting around to anywhere we wanted to go was never a challenege. The bad: The free breakfast buffet was worth exactly what we paid for... (Enough Said). The Ugly: really cant say that there was one, overall a fairly enjoyable stay worth the money. Certainly would return and recommend

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: xiaAlbany
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as it was the one our tour was starting from. You don't always know what to expect from prearranged tour accommodation and we were not disappointed. It was modern with a touch of luxury. King size beds that were comfortable. Bathrooms were well appointed, good size & had a bath. The staff were indifferent & some had minimal English. They spoke among themselves alot & did not make attempts to be chatty or friendly. You have to pay for WiFi but if you go to the lobby you can get it free. Location is OK & it wasn't too difficult getting around from there. The park across the road is worth a visit too. There is coffee & tea making facilities but no milk in the rooms, you need to get this from room service as it will be hot milk??

Reviews.Title: “New, clean, good location”
Reviews.Author: Susanne S
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a weekend in Rome. The NH hotel is in a good location and the busy street in front is not an issue but would also suggest to request a room towards the park which we did and got as requested. We were offered an upgrade which was great. The superior room was very nice and the terrace was huge. The room had a king size bed and since I traveled with a girl friend, they asked if they should make it two twins for us the second night however then forgot but the bed was big enough so ok. The bed was comfortable and the bath room had a shower and tub was big and very new and clean. The American breakfast was really great and had everything you could want. When I was looking for Cappuccino and said to my friend..."looks like they don't have any Cappuccino", one of the waiters heard me and came to me right away asking if I wanted one. They were very attentive and speedy but not in a bad way that makes you feel like you need to hurry. The staff of the hotel was very nice, just Italian which may come across to some like they are not nice, however other cultures are just different and some misunderstand this. We had no problems at all. The hotel is in walking distance to the Spanish Steps etc. It took us about 10 min. I think, not bad at all for all major sites. Would come back any time!

Reviews.Title: “Overall average, location was "okay" but the price was right”
Reviews.Author: Steve9328
Reviews.Content: Of the 4 cities and hotels, this would have to be the one disappointment. I decided on this hotel to save money vs. the Sofitel and would have to rate it average. I asked for a double bed but what we got were two twin beds pushed together. As others have said, it's more of a business hotel. As far as location, its just outside the roman walls near Via Veneto and adjacent to the park. The location makes it difficult for taxi's to get to we got lucky once flagging down a taxi before noticing that there is a taxi stand just on the other side of the wall. But it's a one way "exit" off a main street so getting back, I just had taxi's drop us off a few blocks from the hotel instead of making all sorts of turns to get in front of the hotel. Via Veneto is nice, restaurants and bars along the main street are expensive and even though major sites (Spanish Steps, Fountain Trevi are said to be 0.5 or 0.7 miles, there are steep hills so expect to just take taxi's around. Metro in Rome isn't very useful to get where you want to go either. Hotel was basic. Hardwood floors in my room were pretty warn and dusty/dirty. I had an upgraded room with a view of the park (Villa Borghese). Wasn't much to look at but probably better to have upgraded to not hear road noilse along the busy road that passes in front of the hotel. Breakfast was included in my rate, so overall since we didn't spend lots of time in the room it was okay, but if I went to Rome again, I'd stay more central (near Spanish Steps,Trevi or Pantheon or Piazza Novona)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: AS007
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, excellent facilities, had a excellent room very clean and modern. Location is good more northern than central, all main sites are 10-15 minutes away from foot, would recommend

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money in Rome”
Reviews.Author: AV_Italy
Reviews.Content: I'm travelling a lot in Rome for work,this hotel is the center of the city and you could just walk to reach fontana di Trevi (10 minutes walking) and much more Rome's amenities. NH Vittorio Veneto has new furniture and clean rooms,it's quiet seen it's near to villa Borghese. Breakfast is very good,both salty and sweet with fresh fruits. It can't be said that it's luxurious as other 5 stars hotels of via Veneto,but in my humble opinion this hotel is the best value for money in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, very near the shops and monuments!!!”
Reviews.Author: solanna
Reviews.Content: The hotel was renovated recently (stayed here 4 times even before it was owned by the NH company), has excellent rooms and lots of amenities, great breakfast/room, the staff is very kind and helpful, and it is located in one of the best zones of Rome, Via Veneto, close to all the shops and monuments. The only negative part is that you have to cross a very busy street to enter the old city and its a bit difficult to access by car/taxi.

Reviews.Title: “good and honest”
Reviews.Author: camarotte
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 5 nights at this hotel and it was a good surprise ... the frondesk staff was very helpful and so was the staff at the restaurant. The location is good and there is a lot of restaurants within wlking distance. The metro is not that close... but the bus system in Rome is very efficient , although not very understandable at a glance.

Reviews.Title: “First time as a family”
Reviews.Author: gsol
Reviews.Content: Have stayed several times while on business and decided to take the whole family. The service is good overall, front desk a little disorganized but friendly. The selection of the rooms is somewhat arbitrary, our was small but upon request was upgraded to a really nice one. The breakfast is rich, I dare say fantastic. If you enjoy a somewhat busy, chaotic large hotel atmosphere you will love this NH. Location is central but a little quirky (outside the old city walls but close to via Veneto)..

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but rude front desk staff.”
Reviews.Author: funjetguy
Reviews.Content: As part of an airline crew, I began using this hotel about a year ago. The rooms are spacious enough and the air conditioning is great considering the hot Italian summers. The front desk staff is another story. I can't tell if it is their dislike of airline crews in general, or just their general dispositions. If you read alot of these reviews there seems to be alot of dissatisfaction with the front desk staff. We use another NH hotel in Amsterdam and I find the Dutch to be overly rude and obnoxious. The staff at this hotel in Rome must have been trained in Amsterdam. However, if you go to the breakfast buffet in the morning, the staff their is delightful and very service oriented.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied hotel for business travel”
Reviews.Author: ducatidiver
Reviews.Content: Doing business north of the city so it was a convenient location for my hosts yet was convenient to reach the metro in 10-15 minutes, restaurants and historical places.

Reviews.Title: “Good, dependable hotel”
Reviews.Author: pavia
Reviews.Content: I usually stay here when visiting Rome on business. Double rooms are comfortable and spacious, updated decor- Avoid single rooms if you can afford to do so as the ones I have stayed are small and cramped. Internet access in room, but expensive. Breakfast not bad. Just a bit anonymous, standard, lacks character and charm. Not a place for the romantic weekend break, but a good, safe dependable option.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: oraldina
Reviews.Content: This hotel hosted the international conference of the association for which I am the president, with more than 120 people, providing excellent conference rooms, high level restaurant services, luxury rooms and excellent staff services. Management is excellent, they provided me with a whole task force to respond to any logistic requirements of the conference. The staff was providing a high performance on everything, always smiling, even under stress situations, so I do not absolutely agree with some other visitor saying that the staff was rude. This is offensive in my opinion. Rooms are excellent, if you don't believe it just take a trip to various other hotels in Rome and compare them with those offered by this hotel. So many of you will probably stop saying that the staff should have even provided you with a taxi at a cheap price maybe inside your room taking off directly to the airport... By the way, rooms are really beautiful, with free coffee machine inside the room, reasonable prices at the minibar, excellent sound proofing and deluxe bathrooms. Just take a look at the soap and shampoo set to see the difference with other hotels in Rome. Restaurant and bar services are high quality, menu is much higher quality than many Gordon Ramsey restaurants where I have been around the world. Wine list has reasonable prices, very different from the total silly overpriced wine list prices of many US restaurants. Restaurant and bar staff are very kind and for those who said that some of them are rude, I will simply let you know how one of this staff greeted me this morning. While going to breakfast with my wife he greeted me asking me if I was a bee-grower. Amazed, I answered that if I would, I would have produced a lot of honey. And he replied to me: "strange, you have so much honey with you!", indicating my wife. And you call this rude? Conference catering, provided by the restaurant and bar staff, was excellent, and each of our request was respected, even the fact of having flowers in the conference rooms matching the logo colour of our association! Each room has projectors and they have technicians constantly available to solve any technical problem linked to microphones, slides, computers, etc. Last but not least, they showed an excellent flexibility when asked if they could arrange the chairs (140!!) in a special structure in the morning and then re-arrange them in a total different structure during the lunch, ready for the afternoon, moving tables, micros, etc. Anything negative then? yes, a little thing that in the future I deem could be solved: wifi is to be paid and for all people constantly connected to the internet this could be an issue, but the hotel apparently is working on it, and maybe soon there could be good news.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel With Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: fairall
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for New Year since it had good reviews, was modern (for Italy!) and was good value in comparison to other hotels. The only downside was the incredibly poor, if not rude, service. One of the key points was that the reception staff told us they could not look up the bus times to the airport for us - but could offer us a taxi for 50euros. This would have been fine but we found out from our own initiative that there is a taxi rank only 2mins walk from the hotel where the flat fare from anywhere in the city to Ciampino airport is 30euros!! Naturally we were annoyed the hotel had tried to rip us off. The other point was that the receptionist told us with confidence that the New year celebrations would be happening in completely the wrong square at the other end of the city! Luckily we found out the correct advice from the tourist information office. Apart from this, the hotel represents good value and is within walking distance to the majority of the sites - although our feet did hurt at the end of each day! Also, it is worth noting that there are few bars/restaurants near to the hotel that are affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Base”
Reviews.Author: cynmo
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel. It was a great beginning to a two-week vacation in Italy in early September. When we arrived early in the early morning, incredibly jetlagged, our room was not yet ready, but the manager at the front desk offered us complimentary breakfast and soon after, our room was ready for us to crash for a few hours. He wasn’t overly friendly, but he was very professional and understanding of how tired we were. It was much appreciated. This was our first trip to Rome and we thought that the location of the hotel was perfect for us – within walking distance to many places, such as the Spanish Steps, plus near a metro stop, and a taxi stand. We were also close to the Via Veneto of La Dolce Vita fame. There were many cafes with outside seats that sold expensive drinks, but the people watching was great. Our room was clean, modern, and sunny. We also enjoyed the breakfast, which offered many options. One could quickly become spoiled from it! We can’t wait to plan our return trip to Rome and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Mam180
Reviews.Content: I have to say the rooms and the hotel were very nice. Decor in the rooms was modern, clean and fresh. Nothing spoke to 'old' in the rooms. The beds were comfortable with nice white crisp linens. The breakfast was good and the waiters were friendly when we ordered our regular cappuccinos. When you first arrive to the hotel, the front of the hotel almost resembles an apartment as there are no doormen to greet you. And there are no cabs waiting to pick you up out front but the taxi stand is a block away. I felt like I was close enough to a lot of destinations that I could walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, nice breakfast, but not a turistic hotel”
Reviews.Author: SkyTeamPlatinum
Reviews.Content: This big hotel is located outside the historic center of Rome, in the northeastern area, near Via Vittorio Veneto, where the finest Rome hotels are. The rooms are new and large, and the continental breakfast is very good. However, the hotel is located 20 min by foot from the nearest metro station (and Rome has only 2 lines, so, you have to walk a lot anyway). Not the best location for those who wants to visit the historical sites. The staff makes no effort to be sympathetic. When you are talking to them, at the same time they answer the phone, talk to another people. So they are rude. Why do not give a smile???

Reviews.Title: “room service late; don't bother-tiny room, too”
Reviews.Author: Skykevver
Reviews.Content: I was REALLY tired after traveling to Brazil and England the past few days. So I slept late into the evening thinking if I didn't get up to go have dinner somewhere I could just order some room service. I awoke shortly after midnight and was relieved to read the room service menu indicated I could order until 1am. I looked at the offerings and decided to go simple and easy...Pizza Margherita. About 1240am I called the room service number but got no answer. So I waited a minute and tried the number again. Still no answer. There was another number listed for room service at an earlier time of day, so I tried it. No answer. At this point I am thinking I better call the front desk and see if they can connect me before the deadline...since now it's 1252. The front desk answers and says "No, room service closed 5 minutes ago." I said "I thought I read that it was available until 1am and I have been trying to call them for a while now." The reply "He closed early." My response: "So now I have to go hungry?" Front desk: "Sorry, we don't have a key. Click"

Reviews.Title: “Sleek Modern Design with Great Touches!”
Reviews.Author: PinkTraveller
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel where we had the Villa Borghese/Vatican junior suite - hotel is very nicely furnished/decorated with luxury touches that make you very comfortable. Huge beds, nice daily food treats and very nice bathroom luxuries (the shower gell was like bathing in a big bag of fruit pastels!!). Breakfast was a great choice, the bar very reasonable (and the middle aged barman a joy to be served by - very funny and friendly!). It was our first time in this part of Rome as a base and very much a pleasure - Harrys restaurant just 2 minutes away was a pleasure to dine at - have the lamb rack and die!! Would certainly reccommend the NH - 10 minute walk to the Piazza del Popolo, Spanish Steps or a 2 minute walk to the bus stop to the ColloseumPiazza Venezia - and the local bars/restaurant a dream!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Stephenawatt69
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really great. Staff were friendly and helpful. It is just outside the city walls but we found a walking subway and that only took ten minutes to walk to the spanish steps. Rome is an amazing city and this hotel topped it off. The bed was big and comfortable the room was a decent size and decor was to a very high standard. Breakfast was pretty good. If I was to be picky the one fault would be that rooms didn't have a kettle. There was also a problem with the price. They wanted to charge me more than I had been quoted at booking. However after about 5 minutes of standing my ground, the y charged me the quoted price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: asolanki9
Reviews.Content: Excellent Modern Rooms Great Breakfast Pretty good location - about 5-10 mins walk down the hill to Metro. Front Desk can be a bit rude. Free Wifi in the lobby was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience all round”
Reviews.Author: EmsDublin
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Rome on a few previous trips I know that if I go back again I will definitely stay at this hotel. From the moment we walked in we were made to feel really welcome, from the girls on the reception desk (some of the men were a bit sulky) to the porter who brought in our bags. We arrived at 10.30am but they even still tried to get us a room straight away. It wasn't ready so we went out for a coffee and didn't realise exactly where we were. We crossed over the road, went through an arch and there we were at the top of the Via Veneto! Perfect. When we got our room we were so happy with how clean and fresh everything was, the bed was so comfortable and the bathroom and amenities were great. Breakfast was included in the deal and I thought that it would mean that we would still end up eating out, but no way, I was getting up extra early to spend time at breakfast, it was so good. The fruit, the pastries, the coffee, the only way to start the day! And again the staff in the breakfast room was so pleasant, I couldn't believe it was Rome! The only thing that I would say is if you are going to do the open top bus tour the hotel recommend the blue one which is always full and this is cos, as we later discovered, they are only half as frequent as the red one! So don't go with the blue bus, it's always full! If you do stay here a couple of really good restaurants close by are Pomadorino, La Giara and there's another place on Via Marche with a big yellow neon sign, Ristorante something, looks dreadful from outside but is really delicious! All in all a great hotel and the nicest hotel staff I have ever met!

Reviews.Title: “Good but can be better!”
Reviews.Author: OneTwoFree
Reviews.Content: Recently visited Italy for couple of weeks and stayed in different NH Hotels while Vittorio Veneto was the very 1st and the longest one for 4 nights. Starting from the airport FCO, it's a chaos while no lines up for passport check or the agent not even stamp on my passport! On taxi stand, no one wanted to pick us as four of us had 5 big luggages and 1 hand carry... until a taxi driver who has a bigger taxi asking for EUR50... well, otherwise we may need 2 cabs and costs the same! In Sunday early morning with no traffic, it tooks as 25min to arrive at the hotel door and 2 hotel guys kept talking to each other ignoring us untill my sister asked them to help as there is stairs to lobby. Another guy brought a craft to help and he's really helpful indeed. At the front, the lady told us too early to check-in and there no room available yet not untill 1300hr but she promised to upgarde us to deluxe connecting room. Well, she is also helpful on providing point of interests for us to visit before we could get a room. We returned at 1430hrs but still one room was not ready yet but not for long. Our rooms are on 3rd floor and far away from the lifts but very spacious compare to other European hotels. Rooms are facing the garden but somehow couple of nights before dawn there were very noise as the sound like people throwing garbage into the truck. The bed is very comfortable and you can adjust the tempearture. The bath room is also very bright, clean and spacious with bath tub. The breakfast is good enough but only start at 0700hrs so we'd to skip the last day to catch our early train. Dinning tips: The lady from the front desk recommended an very old restaurant named Girarrosto Toscano to us and the food was so so with the acceptable price. Another day we had 10min walk to Via Vittorio Veneto where are lots of good hotels in there and tried Cafe Veneto Restaurant, good service and good food but very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Britishgoabroad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here very last minute after our flight ws cancelled due to the Volcanic Ash. We arrived at the hotel in the early hours of the morning. the staff were excellent and very efficient. The rooms were fantastic, huge beds, nicely decorated, nice clean bathrooms with bath and shower. We had a lovely view over the park in the morning. We had breakfast in the hotel too, the spread was something special. A cooked buffet as well as a variety of pastries, bread, rolls, toast, fresh fruit, hams, cheese and salami, cereals. juices, coffee etc. Anything you could want really. We were never rushed. the staff again were efficient clearing dishes you had finished with. The hotel is not that close to a metro station so we found it just a quick to walk to Termini station to take a train to Fiumicino. It takes about 20mins. The hotel has a luggage storage room which we used. All in all a very nice hotel. Be prepared to walk a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: Poppy49Reading
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a fantastic weekend in Rome with my husband and cannot speak more highly of both the hotel and Rome itself. We flew in to Fiumicino airport with the intention of taking the train to Termini but after following the train signs around the airport for a while, we realised the train symbol had disappeared. Whilst we were dithering about, we were pounced upon by a man offering us a ride in his minibus ("room for 2 more, I will take you direct to your hotel, 30 euros only") and thought "why not?". It is an understatement to say the journey was 'interesting' and was a great introduction to Rome! The driver was a bit of a character (90 miles per hour, 6 inches from the car bumber in front, one hand on the wheel, talking on the phone) and as we were were the last of 4 couples to be dropped off, we got a great city tour plus commentary for our money!. The hotel is spotlessly clean, modern and the staff pleasant and efficient. We had a standard room (no view, just the building next door) but we were more than happy with this as we planned to spend no time at the hotel other than sleeping and breakfasting. The breakfast is unbelievable - egg, bacon, sausages, tomatoes, tea coffee, croissants, pastries, cakes, doughnuts, toast, cereal, museli, yoghurt, fruit juice, ham, salami, cheese , fruit and I think there must be things I have left off! There were plenty of tables and all the food was kept well 'topped up'. We were delighted with the location as we were within an easy walking distance of so many of the sites, although we caught the metro from Barberini when we went to the Colusseum and from Spagna when we went to the Vatican. The Metro is easy to use but quite shabby compared to the London Underground. Drink in Rome is horrendously expensive (6 or 7 Euros for a beer) although we felt the food was reasonably priced. We didn't eat anywhere fancy but there are so many lovely little restaurantes, trattorias etc down the side streets to choose from you can spend as much or as little as you want. I found the city streets pleasingly clean ( the very efficient bin men were out every night) and there were no horrible rubbish sacks or wheelie bins littering the streets unlike London (where we had a day out the previous weekend). I strongly recommend a good street map and comfortable footwear as the best way to see Rome is by walking - there are so many beautiful little back streets and piazzas to wander around it would be a crime to miss them by travelling in a taxi. Rome is a fantastic destination and I would be more than delighted to go there again and stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: lonastar
Reviews.Content: Little could be said of our stay at Vittorio Veneto . My boyfriend and I stayed there during Christmas season and, all in all, had a great, unforgetable stay. Upon arrival, we requested an upper floor room with park view, which is definitely highly recommended! The receptionist kindly told us that such a room was not ready yet so we would have to wait till usual check in time, that is till 1400. When we asked if we could have a glance to normal, non-park view rooms, the gentle staff promptly guided us to the upper floors and, also,even showed us a park view room which was however somewhat on the ground floor- just to have an idea of what the view would look like so as to compare and contrast. We decided that waiting would be undoubtedly worth it and so it was! Upon return, we were given a card to a splendid room, number 610. It was located on the sixth floor and it also had a balcony. The view was of course stunning, Villa Borghese was right in front of us! The decoration, which is identical in all the rooms shown to us, was really modern and stylish . The double bed was king size and absolutely comfy. The bathroom was another pleasant surprise taken that it was always modern,spotlessly clean, had a bathtube and all imaginable toiletries, even toothbrushes and a small container of disinfectant liquid to take with you, great if you want to clean your hands on the spot. Not to add the fact that the rooms are soundproof. As far a sthe breakfast is concerned, I have stayed at many hotels since I travel a lot and I gladly reassure you that Nh offers you a great breakfast where nothing is really missing : a WIDE range of fresh juices, cakes, various sweets, meats,cheese, bread, milk, jam, omellete, sausages etc. The breakfast area is also a pro, well organised and tastefully designed to satisfy the Nh standards. Last, I would no doubt like to stress out the kindness of the staff. Apart form the fact that they were always smiling and willing to offer some typical " tourst" piece of advice, they surprised us when we asked them whether they knew a nice cinema broadcasting a certain 3D film . Thus, not only did the receptionist informed us on nearby cinemas and called them on our behalf but she also printed for us the cinema schedule, an act which we instantly appreciated! The only Nh con is maybe the fact that the metro di Spagna ( the ENTRANCE to which is 5 minutes from the hotel), is not that close after all since you have to walk underground for some 10-15 minutesto reach the ACTUAL station-platform (which is basically located at Piazza di Spagna)This may be a bit boring if you do it everyday but, still, I consider this a minor detail. I would definitely like to return to Nh again, it is a safe choice , worthing all the money we spent there!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dr_10
Reviews.Content: You don't need something else. Nice modern hotel in very good place in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Robbedoez
Reviews.Content: Hotel with pleasant vibs. Rooms quiet, comfortable large beds, bathroom nicely equipped and including all thinkable toiletries. Breakfast with fresh fruit and espresso. Lots of goodies. Freshly squeezed juices. Parking under the hotel. Hotel within walkable distance from the historic center (20 minutes). And only a couple of minutes away from nice restaurants and bars. Adjacent to the beautiful Park Villa Borghese. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “great location, very nice rooms but some inconveniences...”
Reviews.Author: pradomalo
Reviews.Content: I book this hotel through a friend of mine who works for this hotel chain, Nh Hotels (used to be Jolly in the past). First of all, I have to say that I've been in many Nh hotels, mainly in Spain and Italy... Under my opinion Vittorio Veneto has an eccellent location (it is next to the best hotels in town). Furthermore, it is a modern and young designed hotel, which is good. Unfortunately, I found 3 negative points: 1- the receptionists are unhelpful. I can remember in particular one girl, Sabrina. I asked her for some tips about restaurants and her answer was: Go to Trastevere! (a famous quartier where there are almost one million restaurants!). It was so difficult to suggest a good trattoria?! Seemed that I was disturbing her with my questions. 2- The chambermaid get into our room twice without permission and with the "do not disturb" hold in the door. 3- (the less important..) the breakfast was not good and complete as the other Nh Hotels. Anyway, I liked the hotel and my stay was good enough to go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: AHLOslo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a short stay at the Vittorio Veneto in Roma! The hotel is located just above the Via Veneto, and is a good option if you want to stay in this area, but can't afford the very pricey 5stars along the Via Veneto. I would recommend this to all, except single lady travellers and families with kids. Again becuse of the location. You have to cross a large road to get to the hotel, and asa single lady I would'nt feel safe there, and as a family I wouldn't want to stay there! The rooms are crisp and modern, and the bathroom is GREAT! The only thing you have to bring with you is an iron!! This is the second hotel in Roma that I've stayed in that doesn't have an iron... Strange but true! Small restaurant tip for the neighburhood: Pizzeria San Marco! Very good and very cheap food and drinks! :D

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Front Counter Staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: muncherama
Reviews.Content: For a four star hotel, the front counter staff were all unhelpful and rude. There's no sense of customer service whatsoever!! I'm extremely unhappy about the service in this hotel. I was there for the wedding for my friend and we had book many rooms in this hotel. I had them arranged airport pickup for my boyfriend and I had to triple checked with them to make sure they had arranged it. There was no room available when my friend's family trying to check in. Very poor communication among staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean & comfortable, great breakfast, good location”
Reviews.Author: freekeys
Reviews.Content: My partner and I visited this hotel for a weekend break during September. We arrived late at night and were at first worried by the slow service at check-in. We were pleased to check-in, however, to a very comfortable, clean and aesthetically pleasing room. The room was very spacious (huge bed!), modern and quiet. The view of the road wasn't ideal but we had plenty of time to see views in the city itself. Breakfast was very good with a wide selection of cornetos (italian croissants), cakes, bread, cereals, fruits, yoghurts and bacon/sausages & scrambled egg. The hotel is a 1 min walk from the South Eastern entrance to the wonderful Villa Borghese Park and 10/15 mins from the Spanish Steps. The Spagna Metro Station at the Piazza de Spagna (by the Spanish Steps) will take you to The Vatican and the Colosseum areas in 3 or 4 stops. If you want cleanliness, moderness, close proximity to the city, this is the place to come!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: GetawaygirlLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel overlooks the Borghese gardens so it is a bit further from the centre but a nice location by this beautiful park which is well worth visiting. (There's a zoo there if you have younger children with you). If you book the tour bus which the hotel recommends you will find it stops near the hotel. (Unfortunately I booked one online which didn't!). It's about 15 mins walk from the Spanish Steps which is a lovely area, good for shopping and restaurants. The hotel itself is very modern with lovely, spacious rooms which are really comfortable. Breakfast is excellent and was included in our deal.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly rude staff”
Reviews.Author: nobre
Reviews.Content: Stayed there nearly one week in August and we were surprised at the staff behaviour: it's difficult to believe that a four stars hotel has such a rude and unprofessional personnel!! Let's start with the pros: the rooms are nice and clean, the hotel location is very good (next to Villa Borghese park, few minutes to Piazza Navona). And now the cons: the entrance is quite confusing, there are some stairs and never a bell-boy outside to help you if you have your baggage, the front desk staff is slow and unprofessional (when we checked in there were some people coming in and out the back office without even caring about all the guests waiting in the lobby), a maid entered our room although we put the "Do not disturb" paper out of our room door; the breakfast is very poor and, rather ridiculously, ends at 10:00 am despite all the people were on leisure trip.. Is it enough? No, it isn't, because they would be minor inconveniences if only the staff was a little more careful and kind! At the reception and in particular in the breakfast room, the staff (very often without wearing name badge) is extremely impolite and unprofessional! On the 15th of August, which is a national holiday, a girl at the reception told us, in a brusque way, without even raising her head from what she was doing, that everything was closed and there was nothing to do in Rome that day (actually, it was just the opposite!); at the check-out a boy with a very unfriendly manner, although being informed that we were waiting for a private car to pick us up, didn't do anything when the driver asked for us (finally, we met him by chance). Not to mention the rudeness of the personnel in the breakfast room... To sum up, we were astonished at their behaviour, especially in a very welcoming city as Rome is!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great rooms, stall rather mediocre”
Reviews.Author: ehorner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice on our holiday. First for 2 nights when we first arrived. The airlines lost our backage from St Petersburg, the hotel tried to help, but didn't really do that much. The front office woman was convinced that because we never filed a police report (i've never done this for lost bagage) we wouldn't see our bags again. we left a tag with her for the afternoon, she said she would call, and she claimed she did, and she said they had no knowledge our our luggage. This freaked us out a little, so we called ourselves and they replied that we would have our bags that evening, leading me to question if the front office woman ever called. Despite this rather small setback, the hotel was lovely, and in a good location (not perfect but good). Also the hotel bed's were awesome. Memory foam bed's with a pillow top made exhausting day wanding around rome a distant memory. We also stayed at this hotel in our 1 night stop over in rome to catch our flight the next day. The best rest we had in 6 different hotels over 2 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well located hotel ... service so so”
Reviews.Author: Universaltraveller84
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel after booking the LastMinute.com 'Top Secret Hotel' Rome citybreak trip. Really good value for money and hotel quality really good - good size bedrooms with all mod cons and clean etc. Only drawback was that I had pre-booked an airport transfer through the hotel in advance which had been confirmed on email, but no car turned up to pick us up and when we called the hotel they were not helpful/friendly. On check-in at the hotel, again hotel staff not friendly and they took a long time to go through the necessary procedures. Great location though at great price. There is a large main road right by the hotel, but we didn't hear the road from our room on the 6th floor. All Rome must-sees are walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MS2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days in July 2009. The location was fantastic. We were able to walk to the Borghese Gallery, a nearby zoo, Via Veneto, the Spanish Steps, the Hard Rock Cafe Rome, shopping, and the Trevi Fountain. Every morning there was a fantastic breakfast buffet that had every possible type of food. The location was absolutely perfect. The room was clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Staff training required...”
Reviews.Author: Elbeth
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in July 09. Had a room overlooking the beautiful Villa Borghese garden on the sixth floor. Great room / bathroom - very modern and had everything we needed included BBC World on the plasma TV! The hotel is just outside the city wall (all-important for taxi fares to the airports - take one from inside the city walls!)... you can walk to the Via Veneto in 5 minutes (recommend Harry's bar for cocktails and people-watching) and around 15 minutes to the Spanish steps. There were two things which let the hotel down - firstly, it takes an incredible amount of time to check in and out and the reception staff do not know the meaning of customer service - the lady who served me looked like she hadn't smiled in 10 years. Breakfast staff, whilst more friendly, clearly had little clue about looking after a busy restaurant - food ran out, cutlery missing, warm milk, tables not cleared (or cleared when you didn't want them to be!)... in short, some staff training would improve this hotel greatly and would make it a true 4 star. PS watch out for glass shelf in wardrobe - sliced my thumb open on it!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel which was the icing on the cake”
Reviews.Author: MGPOSH1970
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of wifes 40th birthday trip. We were upgraded to a suite on the 7Th floor overlooking the gardens. The room was massive, clean and wonderfully equipped and decorated. The staff could not do enough for us and really made the trip. The buffet breakfast was good with lots of choice, one tip would be to get there earlyish as the restaurant is abit on the small side and it does get busy. The location was good, a nearby busstop or a walk to the spanish steps which we could do in 15 minutes. Overall I could not really find much to fault this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Revamped, Stylish and a Great Location for Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: miclogan
Reviews.Content: I didn't actually select this hotel out of choice, I opted for the 'Top Secret Hotel' option on lastminute.com - life on the edge no less. I must admit, I was initially sceptical as I had read the pre-revamp reviews and a couple of the newer ones and they weren't exactly shouting from the roof tops. I was wrong to be sceptical, the hotel was perfect for our needs. Very clean, friendly and helpful staff who spoke very good English (thankfully, as my Italian is basic to say the least) and very modern. I had booked a standard room with breakfast, so it wasn't exactly huge, but it was modern and minimalist and everything worked as expected. The only thing it was missing was any tea/coffee making facilites, no great shakes really. When visiting Rome, there's so much to see that the amount of time that you spend in your hotel room is insignificant, so as long as it's comfy, clean and quiet (which it was) then I'm a happy man. Given that it's next to a wide and busy road at the front, the noise is barely noticeable; that said I was on the 5th floor at the side. Breakfast was absolutely spot on, plenty to choose from - bacon, scrambled eggs, sausages, toast, cakes, crosissants, cereal, fresh fruit, yoghurts and a fine selection of fruit juices, mineral water and of course coffee. Again, staff were very friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is perfect, next door to the beautiful Villa Borghese Park, and within walking distance of plenty of sights. We walked everywhere during our 3 day stay, too much to to miss if you get the Metro. I'd happily stay at the hotel again, highly recommended. Only one complaint over the entire stay, and that is that they don't have ironing boards available in the hotel - I love ironing!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in close center of Rome”
Reviews.Author: alexxka
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Rome and I'm really impressed by the city as well as by this lovely hotel. I've been to NH hotel before and liked their style so that is why I chose this one and didn't get disappointed. I'd have be a real stickler to find something disturbing. Modern stylish interior, good location - 10 minutes by walk from Piazza di Spagna, Piazza del Popolo and other sightseeing highlights. It is directly at Villa Borghese, large Roman park. We got standard room with the street view and large terrace 10x10 meters - lovely! I guess the rooms with Villa Borghese view are for smokers (as usually they get the better). Very comfortable queen-size bed, large bathroom. Breakfast was in buffet style with plenty of food and very delicious. Staff at reception was formaly nice and helpful - no issues and the staff at the restaurant was very efficient. I've noticed there was still some reconstruction going on which could be disturbing for the rooms on the lower floors - that is just my guess - better ask for this in advance. Otherwise perfect, highly recommended! You get reasonable price when you reserve it at least 2 months in advance. And Rome itself is wonderful, we had really unforgetttable Roman holiday :-)

Reviews.Title: “disappointed by deluxe room”
Reviews.Author: thingummyjig
Reviews.Content: Booked a deluxe room at this recently refurbished hotel, now called the NH Vittorio Venento, and were given a room on the 6th floor overlooking the Borghese Gardens. The hotel is situated on the a busy motorway in an industrial looking building. Room had a pleasant contemporary decor, somewhat spoilt by the cheap laminate wood-effect flooring. The bed was large and linens crisp and luxurious, but the room was disappointingly small, so I wonder what the standard rooms are like. The bathroom was also tiny, with a bidet crammed into a corner and a weak telephone shower over the bath. Chrome soap holder over the bath is already coming off the wall, and the tap over the washbasin was fitted at a slant - poorly finished! Staff were variable, some cool and frosty, and some warm and friendly. Breakfast had good fresh fruit and juices, together with the usual continental offerings. Delicious chocolate torte should not be missed. Location is good, right next to the Villa Borghese but you need to like walking, as it is a fair distance to the Spanish steps and other sights in the historic centre. The walk was pleasant in mid- May, but I wouldn't like to do it in the heat of July/Aug. Overall, I would recommend, but feel the deluxe rooms are overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “avoid room 238”
Reviews.Author: frits65
Reviews.Content: Room 238 has a narrow window that opens (if you dare to open it) in the bottom of a well filled with dirty stuff. Impossible to have day light or fresh air in the room, unless you are not afraid of rats, bugs and burglars that might come in. Burglars could get in even with a closed window. Don't look at the pictures shown on the internet. Only a few rooms per floor are renovated. Our room had old furnishing but it was clean and the breakfast was very nice. Wouldn't say the same for the staff in the breakfast room thought. They were unhelpfull and rude. Wouldn't stay there again because they gave us the worst and most dangerous room in the hotel at the price of a normal room.

Reviews.Title: “Previously the 'Jolly Vittorio Veneto', this hotel has recently changed hands and has been completely renovated! Delightful!”
Reviews.Author: HHowells
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. It has recently changed hands from 'Jolly' to 'NH' and as a result has been completely renovated. Some of the reviews for the 'Jollly Vittorio Veneto' reported a dated, tired 70s feel to the hotel which could be offputting. We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived on 12th March for a weekend as supporters of the Welsh rugby team playing Italy in the 6 Nations International! I have written a thorough review under 'Jolly Vittorio Veneto'.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted by an unexpected contemporary revamp! Fantastic hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: HHowells
Reviews.Content: Our purpose of visiting Rome was to watch the Italy V Wales 6 Nations rugby match. We booked via a local travel agent called Robert Davies Sports Travel and one of our friends chose the hotel from a list provided by the agent. On finding out that the chosen hotel was the 'Jolly Vittorio Veneto' , as always I consulted my trusty Tripadvisor for reviews, albeit with jittery fingers as on this occasion I was resigned to the fact that however good or bad the reviews were, the selection was beyond my control! On doing so I was rather deflated and disappointed by the comments on the dated, tired 70s feel of the hotel and the indifference of the staff. So on Thursday 12th March I set off full of excitement about Wales beating Italy (which they did!!!) the fantastic atmosphere that awaited us and revisiting some of the sights we'd marvelled over during my husband and my first trip to Rome 5 years ago! The shine was slightly dulled by my apprehensions over the accommodation! On arrival at the hotel I had the most wonderful surprise!! 'Jolly Vittorio Veneto' was no more!! It had changed hands and had become 'NH Vittorio Veneto'! We had stayed in a wonderful NH hotel in Salzburg and the initial sightings of this Roman sister were looking familiar and promising! The reception area, bar and dining room were modern and delighfully decorated and accessorised, the reception staff were friendly and efficient (unphased by the scores of unbeat Welsh rugby fans descending upon them!!) Up we went in the brand spanking new lift and along the brand spanking newly decorated corridor to our room which was light, colourful, minimalist and spotless! The bedroom was adequate in size and hosted a large wall mounted plasma TV with a lovely lime-green surround. The bathroom was all brown tiles and floor -again very contemporary and tasteful-with clean lines. The bed was comfortable and because it was obviously so new it was about the first time ever that I did not wake up each morning with a sniffly nose and puffy eyes due to old dust mites!! My husband often suffers terribly with this as he has asthma and even he didn't have any problems! The breakfast was pleasant, largely the usual continental breakfast with a good selection but scrambled eggs, bacon and little sausages were also on offer The lovely fresh fruit was the defining feature! The locality of the hotel was very good. Despite that fact that the hotel is situated on a busy thoroughfare, it is right next to the Villa Borghese park which was very pleasant to walk around (there are zoological gardens and a museum of modern art for those interested) and we were also at the top of the prestigious street 'Via Vittoria', where the famous 'Cafe de Paris' is situated as well as the amazing 'Harry's Bar', both of which are worth a visit if only for a coffee or glass of wine! The hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the Spanish Steps and we got around most of the sights quite easily by foot although there is a Metro station close by. There are some pleasant bars and restaurants (try 'La Bruscheta' for a lovely meal/atmosphere/friendly staff) locally if you don't fancy going further afield! All in all, I was delighted by the hotel. The only reason I'm not awarding it 5 stars is because I feel quite strongly that the bar prices are ridiculously extortionate! HALF a pint of beer is 7.5 Euros (which at the moment is over £7!!) and a coffee/diet coke is around 5 euros!! We didn't eat in the restaurant but heard reports that it was extortionate! Out and about in Rome, the cheapest pints we came across were in the off the beaten track bars at around 5 euros, but many city centre bars and restaurants are charging 7 or 8 euros!! Be prepared for an eye-opener when eating and drinking out!! One last comment! If you are visiting Rome for future welsh rugby international games, NH Vittorio Veneto is a good one to go for because many of the big names stay there! We saw Gareth Edwards, Phil Bennett and the radio presenter Roy Noble in the lifts/at breakfast!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful terrace”
Reviews.Author: flamingokate
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Jolly V V in 1993 and found it to be very clean, nicely decorated, fresh, well-located and good value (included VAT and buffet breakfast). When we read the reviews this year prior to booking we were disappointed to see that the hotel had not kept up the terrific standard we had enjoyed BUT we did find out that there were a few terraces. We used email to make our reservation for 4 nights and asked for a room with a private terrace. When we arrived we had to push a little at the desk to get the terrace but we got it. Room 521. (we wanted the 7th floor because the terraces would have better views). The room was adequate - good bathroom, good closet, dresser, flat screen tv (small), bar fridge, electric kettle and coffee/tea packets, window facing Villa Borghese, terrible bed, airconditioning difficult to adjust, glass doors to terrace (step up). The terrace was awesome - 14' x 20' with a nice patio table and chairs. During our four nights at the Jolly; we would enjoy coffee on our terrace in the morning, a lovely buffet, tour in the morning, enjoy a nice lunch on our terrace, walk again all afternoon then back to the terrace for relaxing before heading out for dinner. Located near the top of Via Veneto we found it easy to walk to Spanish Steps thru the tunnel, down to Trevi, etc. Sometimes we took a taxi back to the hotel for around 8 Euros. We paid 200 Euros per night - VAT and Breakfast included. Kathy

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced to the Extreme”
Reviews.Author: charlie47
Reviews.Content: I had two nights in the Jolly Hotel and problems first started when I checked in and I could not get the room I wanted and was put in a 'deluxe' room over looking the dlightful Corso Italiano, a very (24 Hour) busy throughfare, which seemed to be used for Italian drivers to test their car horns!!! The room had barely any room at all, with a desk cramped up against the bed, and internet access was expensive and intermittent on the 5th floor (It was much better on the ground floor in the bar, where I ended up having do my work in a reliable way). Room service was OK, and food was OK, but I have stayed in better hotels for far less money and I would warn all visitors to be very careful about rates. This was not by any stretch of the imagination value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Jolly Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: owen100
Reviews.Content: Being disinclined to spend a small fortune on a Rome hotel - Holy Week prices seem particularly steep - we decided to brave the Jolly Hotel Vittorio Veneto, despite some very negative reviews on this website. What an excellent choice this turned out to be. For €185 per night - a steal by Roman standards - we had a large, well-appointed room, with a fantastic roof terrace overlooking the Borghese Gardens, and an excellent view of St Peter's in the distance. The bathroom was perfectly adequate, and came complete with a decent length bath - as opposed to merely a shower. Everything was spotlessly clean. Breakfast - served in the slightly 70s feeling ground floor restaurant - was included in the price. This consisted of a buffet, with a choice of the usual ham, salami, cheese etc, bacon and eggs, and a range of other goodies. Enough to stock up for the day if need be. The service was perfectly pleasant and efficient. We also used the hotel's car to the airport - slightly more than the fixed price taxi fare (although arguably this does not apply since the hotel is just outside the walls of Rome) but a whole lot pleasanter. The location of the hotel is superb - if you like this end of Rome, that is. It is a short walk to the Spanish Steps and the Via Veneto (a stone's throw from Harry's Bar), just opposite the entrance to the Borghese Gardens, and pretty close to the best (in my view) collection in Rome, namely the Villa Borghese. Altogether, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Decent”
Reviews.Author: TJ-USA
Reviews.Content: We only stayed at the hotel one night. Our stay there was booked by the cruise line. When we read reviews on the hotel, we were a little concerned about what to expect as most reviews we read seemed to be average at best. However, all four in our party agreed that the hotel was decent and clean and not as bad as some of the reviews we read. As regular travelers, we want reasonable and decent accomodations at a reasonable price. We geverally don't book top quality accomodations as we spend little time at the hotel and only use it as a base during our trips. The documents provided to us lists it as a 4 star hotel which in the US means upscale. In Europe, it means average as I would say it was comparable to any large chain mid scale hotel in the United States that would cost between $70-$100 per night depending on location (obviously, more money in prime locations). However, the room was clean, decent and equipped with the essentials. It was also very close to the park and local attractions. Even if we were staying longer, it would have met our expectations and we were satisfied with it. Our luggage was lost by the airline.The hotel obviously had no connection to our lost luggage, so they were not willing to offer any help in that department which is fully understandable. I certainly did not expect them to track my luggage, however, when I asked for a phone book to call the airline , any phone numbers they might be aware of or for help with getting an outside line to make calls (which I was charged for), the front desk offered no help and more or less ignored me and point blank said "not our problem." Again, I was not asking them to track it, just help with finding a phone book or numbers since this appears to be a frequent occurence. Numerous others that were in the hotel and on the same cruise experienced lost luggage. In my opinion, the level of customer service in the United States is definitely higher. Not just in the hotels, but all around. I would probably have given a higher rating if even the minimal amount of help or advice was offered.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for the price”
Reviews.Author: C0SM0
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just got back from two nights at the Jolly Hotel. For the price (we paid about 120 pounds per night) it's a fine place to stay - the hotel won't make your stay in Rome extra special, but it won't ruin your stay either. Our standard double room was an older style and quite small and, although the room was clean, the fixtures appear a bit worn and shabby. The good-sized bathroom has an antique for a hairdryer which smelt smokey when being used. Breakfast is a buffet with a good selection of cereals, breads, croissants, scrambled eggs and juices. Staff are friendly and helpful - I would definitely recommend taking them up on their offer to organise a car for the airport for EUR50. We caught a taxi from the airport to the hotel and booked a car on the way back - the taxi cost EUR55 and the car was a much more pleasant experience. The hotel is in a great location - opposite Via Veneto and a short 10 minute stroll to the Spanish Steps. If you're looking for somewhere to leave your bags while you explore the awesome sights of Rome, then the Jolly Hotel is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: iandel
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here at the beginning of September ('05) whilst on holiday in Rome, and were both happy with the place. The rooms are well-sized, modern and clean. Our room was at the back of the hotel & so offered a nice view of Villa Borghese. The location is good - 2 things nearby are the Spanish Steps and the Trevi Fountain. The tourist attractions in Rome are spread out across the city, so you will never find somewhere that is right next to everything. Nonetheless, we were able to walk to everything we wanted to see during the day - was about an hour to the Vatican - and got cabs back at night. We never paid more than about 8 Euros for a cab. The breakfast was fine - buffet style with various options. For eating out, try to avoid the temptation of going to one of the rip-off places on nearby Via Veneto. A good area reasonably nearby is in the squares just north of the Pantheon.

Reviews.Title: “not so good”
Reviews.Author: Miss_Najla
Reviews.Content: i have been to rome last week and i stayed at this hotel, the staff members in the reception were not friendly at all , the break fast was so bad with dirty glasses and dirty plates, there was no cheese in the breakfast,

Reviews.Title: “very nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter & I were guests at Jolly Vittorio Veneto 6/24-7/1/05. We were impressed by the friendly English-speaking staff, especially the concierge. The room was clean & had all amenities except a radio alarm clock. (They were excellent at giving us wake-up calls on time). We kept the air conditioning on the coldest setting & closed the drapes every day as the room would get quite warm during Rome's heatwave. Breakfast was excellent every day--croissants, scrambled eggs, 6 varieties of cereal, fresh fruit, juices, water (gas & non-gas), nutella, butter, bacon, sausage, cold cuts, rolls, bread, toast. There was no fitness center on site. It was in the area & cost 25 euros, so we never utilized it. The bar/lounge was closed during part of our stay due to renovations, but it looked very nice. The hotel's location is great. Take a right out the front door & walk to the park across the street, to shops, restaurants, Spanish Steps, Trevi. The concierege provides guests with a map. We took taxis to the Vatican--well worth it. We walked back one day & it was quite a trek. It certainly seemed farther than 2.5 miles. We're avid walkers, but it was tough in the heat & sun. I recommend taking a hand-held battery-operated fan & an umbrella! The Borghese Park across the street has a permanent hot-air balloon available for rides & there is a zoo, but we weren't able to do either. The museum at the park is supposed to be very nice. We walked through the park many times. We had the hotel pick us up from the airport & bring us there for our return flight. The cost was 50 euros for pick-up & 45 for departure. It was well worth it! The taxi drivers were friendly & we didn't have to carry our luggage. The concierge has a brochure for bus trips outside & within rome. We took a trip to Capri, which was 2 hours away. It was quite enjoyable. We had nice tour guides & met people from all over the world. I recommend sea-bands (available at drug stores in the U.S.) for the boat rides from Naples & to the Blue Grotto. Watch your head going in & out of the grotto! Duck down in the rowboat! In summary, I highly recommend this hotel. It was a little pricey, but worth it for all of the above reasons. The luxury hotels on Via Veneto certainly looked spectacular, but were out of our price range. Have a wonderful time! Try to visit Italy before June or after August when it isn't so hot.

Reviews.Title: “not all that.”
Reviews.Author: honestopinion4u
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are mediocre. We had no carpets, and the rooms are older looking. The restaurant..beware..do not eat any meals besides breakfast there. Hysterically expensive and terrible tasting. An o.k. place to stay, but not much more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We only booked the first five nights of our 18 day trip to italy to be flexible. We planned to book the other hotels a couple of days prior to our arrival in the next town via internet. When we were headed to Rome we checked Expedia. There were not many options at 4 star level. I am glad that we did not book to far ahead as we had some disapointments with what we had aready booked. I feel you must book 4 star hotels to be comfortable. The one 2 star we stayed at was a dump. The Jolly was easy to find with valet parking for our rental car (35 Euro per day). Our room on the first floor was a nice size, comfortable bed, clean bath with tub and shower. My wife took a long hot bubble bath in the big tub after a long day of exploring Rome. The staff was professional, proper, nice, and helpful. The hotel is modern in design and has all the comforts of an American higer end style major chain. Breakfast was good with plenty of things to choose from. We booked the first two nights on Expedia, when we considered adding an extra night we thought we were told 117 Euro so we decided to stay the extra night. They moved us to a nicer room on the 4th floor that was much quieter than the traffic at first floor room. I would request an upper floor if they have it available. 117 Euro sounded like a great deal however, when we checked out they billed us 217 Euro. The clerk that quoted us the night before was not there so when they said 217 instead of 117 we don't know if he mispoke or we misunderstood. I am going to email them with a request for an explanition and or refund. This modern quiet oasis from the bustle of Rome made our three night stay pleasurable. We would return on an upper floor with full understanding of the rates.

Reviews.Title: “Our Trip in July 2004”
Reviews.Author: DinshawAvari
Reviews.Content: August 6, 2004 My wife and I visited Rome from July 11 to 15, 2004. What a great city. We stayed at the Jolly Hotel Vittorio Veneto (very close to Via Veneto) and walked ALL over the city. I would definetely recommend this hotel to people going to Rome. Rome is very “walk-friendly” (pardon my English) and you don’t need a taxi once you know the lay of the land. You definetely do not need to rent a car. We saw a great play (short duration) located at the Marmitime Prison (called Caesar - it’s not Just a Salad) by the Miracle Players (see their web site). Superb and very entertaining. The main sites to see are Pantheon & surroundings, Piazza Spagna and surroundings, Via Corso (from end to end - not too long), Vittoria Emmanuele Monument, Roman Forum & surroundings, Colloseum & surroundings, Vatican & surroundings. We couldn’t see it, but Piazza Navona is a must as is the cruise on the Tiber River, I believe, and we regret we could not get to see these two interests. If you are into scuba diving, there are dive operators who operate out of Rome too.

Reviews.Title: “dirty ,warm and cozy ?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Staff is great, they make you feel warm and cozy, breakfast was included , it was fine, lots of nothing really, but it was ok. My FIRST room was dirty, the carpeting was dirty, stained and right in your face. The bed cover was dirty,old and stained. Of course, I refused the room and was immediatley changed . The new room was fine the floor was tiled, the bed cover in better condition. Problem: money was missing, first change was taken, I didn't say anything it was only 2 euro. Next day and my last day, 50.euro was missing from my wallet. I had put my airline ticket, passport and 50.euro for the taxi together. The 50. was taken, not spent, lost or misplaced. I reported it to the hotel, they were very caring and couldn't be more helpful. They didn't return the money, but did send a bottel of wine, which I returned. Don't leave money around no matter how warm and cozy you feel.
